top_comment.text:
What do you do with all that oil afterwards? Do you pour them down the 
kitchen sink?﻿
top_comment.author: hktmc300

comments.text:
+Summer Noybn But not old oil that's been used for several different foods 
and meals. They change the oil daily and only cook one type of food in each 
fryer, so you don't get that nasty cross-food contamination taste :P
comments.author: Packed Punch

comments.text:
+Packed Punch well then pour it in your yard, its biodegradable.. dont pour 
it down the sink for heavens sake... clog your pipes and create an oil 
slick on the water supply heh.  Hate to tell you but if you every buy fast 
food, you are eating oil thats been used many many many times heh.
comments.author: Summer Noybn

comments.text: +RuralBreakfast That's nasty...
comments.author: Packed Punch

comments.text: No. Let it cool down, and then save it for a few more uses.
comments.author: RuralBreakfast

comments.text: +Mohammed Ismael Correct. You can use it few times.
comments.author: RuralBreakfast

comments.text: +Lacey matthews Exactly. You can re-use it.
comments.author: RuralBreakfast

comments.text:
+Lacey matthews
gross... I use fresh oil everytime. I cant stand the taste old oil gives 
food...
comments.author: Packed Punch

comments.text:
I usually store it in a steel container once it has cooled completely and I 
strain it through an washcloth! I reuse it whenever I'm frying something 
else!
comments.author: Lacey matthews

comments.text:
Oil can be reused as long as it is strained and has not been burned (if the 
oil gets too hot and smokes badly the chemical makeup of the oil is damaged 
and more cancer causing agents are formed, as well as the smoke point for 
future frying is reduced) when you are done with it, it should NOT be 
poured down the sink, ESPECIALLY if you are on a septic system, but even 
with a sewer system it is not recommended, not good for your pipes, the 
sewage system as a whole, or the environment.  Veg oil IS biodegradable 
though, so simply pouring it in an inconspicuous spot in your yard is good 
enough heh.
comments.author: Summer Noybn

comments.text: Maybe store it for later?
comments.author: Mohammed Ismael

top_comment.text: you need to show us how to cut potatoes easily and nicely.﻿
top_comment.author: My Name is Not

comments.text:
Yea the skin has lots of minerals.

I guess I could give a bit more of a detailed explanation on how to cut 
like this:

Cut the potato in half (lengthways) and place the flat side on the chopping 
board. Cut vertically and then take those bits of potato and put them on 
their flat side and then cut them into fries.
comments.author: informationwarfare

comments.text: +informationwarfare Exactly, and keep the skins on as well :D

comments.text: With a knife and skill.

top_comment.author: bluedazzle1316

comments.text: +Ryan Joyal Amen!  Just want to add, a good temp to fry them at is 375 :)
comments.author: Summer Noybn

comments.text:
Fry raw wings in deep fryer for 8-10 mins or until they float and are 
crispy golden brown. (Do not bread them or anything) take them out and put 
them on plate with paper towels. Have tupperware containers close by, add 
wings and choice of sauces. Shake until coated to perfection and serve with 
Maria's Blue cheese dressing. Can I get an Amen

top_comment.text:
omg the struggle. heres how to make French fries the easy way. :
1. buy real potatoes and slice them
2. fill a pot full of veg oil on high heat
3. pour all your fries in and drain them when they are golden brown
4. season with salt and pepper.
simple﻿

comments.text:
no way, that results in fries that are too dark, limp or crisp on the

comments.text:
It's too overpowering in my opinion, but cooking is all about preferences

comments.author: DerpSpY05

comments.text:
In Spain we fry with olive oil... In fact it does resist temperature pretty 
well... I've studied in a culinary school and that's what they told us. Of 
course you aren't gonna get a neutral flavor at all, but isn't olive oil 
delicious?
comments.author: Triskelita

comments.text:
No, olive oil can't handle hight temperature, and it will ruin the flavor 
of the fries, use some neutral oil, Canola, Sunflower etc.
comments.author: DerpSpY05

captions.text:
Hi Guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to show you

how to make homemade French fries. So many
of you have been asking for this and I kind

of been debating making this recipe because
I mean it is kind of is a recipe but not really,

it's more like a method that I am showing
you, which is kind of like what I think is

the perfect way to make French fries to get
them to that crispiness on the outside and

like fluffiness on the inside. Now, the ingredients
that you are going to need are two, you are

going to need potatoes and oil to fry them
in. I am using vegetable oil which I have

here coming up to temperature to 310 degrees
Fahrenheit. As for the potatoes, I am just

using russet potatoes that I have peeled and
these are really big ones that I cut into

like fries shape. You can use a mandolin for
this, you can use and actual French fry cutter.

I just used a knife because I don't have any
fancy equipment like that. Now what I have

got here is my French fries, my potatoes I
have them soaking in cold water and I have

had them in here for about a half an hour.
What that does, you can see the water is not

very clear, it's kind of foggy, because it
is releasing it's starch. Now, the more starch

the potato releases in the water, the crispier
the potatoes are going to be when you fry

them up. So! I have had these in here for
about a half an hour and I am going to take

those out and I am going to put them on a
single layer on a baking sheet because it

is absolutely crucial that you dry your potatoes
completely before frying them otherwise it

can be such a hazard and you can get really
hurt because the water will bubble up everywhere

and that would be really really bad. So just
take a minute to lay them nice and flat and

I am just going to take a kitchen towel. I've
got one right over here. I am going to take

a couple of minutes to make sure they are
really nicely patted dry. Let's see. Ya! These

look great! Now what we are going to do is
we are going to double cook the French fries.

We are going to cook them twice at two different
temperature because they are going to -.that

method is going to serve two different purposes.
The first time we cook them which is going

to be now, they are going to be a low temperature,
about 310 degrees Fahrenheit. I am doing that

because I want to cook these on the inside.
They are not going to be crispy, they are

not going to be a golden brown all over, but
they are going to be, just going to do half

at a time, as you can see it is not sizzling
and that's fine - oops stuck - but they are

going to ensure that the middle are cooked
all the way through. So I am going to let

those cook for about 8 minutes or so and then
I am going to take them out and put them on

a paper towel again just to drain the excess
oil, then do the second batch and then we

will change the temperature. Now, my potatoes
cooked for about 8 minutes at 310 degrees.

Now I have taken them out 7 to 8 minutes.
I have taken them out and you can see they

are lightly colored, but look, very, very,
very soft. But if you take a knife, pierce

it through, it pierces right out, it is perfectly
cooked all the way through, which is what

we want. Now what I did was turn the heat
up quite a bit and I got my oil up to about

380. You want it really really nice and hot.
Just like we did the first time, I am going

to do this in two batches. I am going to add
my fries back in and this time you can see

they are bubbling up immediately. These are
going to take absolutely no time at all, they

are going to take a matter of just a minute
or so. They are going to get a beautiful dark

golden brown color and then I am going to
take them out onto the paper towel again and

do my second batch and I will show you what
they look like when they are done. Season

them as soon as they come out. I just added
my second batch. Look at these! Mmm. I tell

you, there is nothing quite like home made
French fries. It is like that special thing,

like the inside of a watermelon, like the
center slices of a watermelon, it is like

the juiciest thing ever. Home made French
fries, there is nothing quite like them. Very

hot! So good! Not that you need the written
recipe but if you want it go to LauraintheKitchen.com

it will be there waiting for you. I am going
to babysit these, serve them to my quests.

I hope you have enjoyed spending time with
me and I will see you next time. Bye.

title: Homemade French Fries Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 593
